cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi (290 km) E of Antigua
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west then turning WNW across the northern Leeward Islands toward the Turks & Caicos/Bahamas and ultimately toward the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South-central or southeast Florida (Keys to Palm Beach County) – first U.S. coastal encounter

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida at this advisory (only Leeward Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks & Caicos, and Bahamas under watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings in effect for the northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba and the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: 34–50 kt winds possible; peak probabilities (34 kt 44%, 50 kt 18%) Sun–Mon with potential hurricane-force gusts if the track shifts west toward the coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft surge along the Palm Beach County coast and Lake Worth Inlet if the center passes just offshore or makes landfall south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of heavy rain possible, leading to freshwater flooding around port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breakers, dangerous rip currents and coastal erosion impacting channel approaches and berth operations
